recipe_001.name: Lugaw (Rice Porridge)
recipe_001.ingredients: Rice, chicken broth, ginger, onion, chicken strips
recipe_001.nutrition_facts: High in carbohydrates, easy to digest, good for sick children. Contains protein from chicken.
recipe_001.instructions: Cook rice in chicken broth until soft and creamy. Add minced ginger and onion. Top with small chicken strips.

recipe_002.name: Ginisang Munggo (Mung Bean Stew)
recipe_002.ingredients: Mung beans, pork strips, malunggay leaves, tomato, onion
recipe_002.nutrition_facts: High in protein and fiber. Rich in folate and iron. Malunggay provides vitamins A and C.
recipe_002.instructions: Boil mung beans until soft. Saut√© pork, tomato, onion. Combine and add malunggay leaves.

recipe_003.name: Sopas (Filipino Chicken Macaroni Soup)
recipe_003.ingredients: Elbow macaroni, chicken, cabbage, carrots, evaporated milk
recipe_003.nutrition_facts: Balanced meal with carbs, protein, and vegetables. Calcium from milk supports bone development.
recipe_003.instructions: Cook chicken and shred. Boil macaroni. Combine with vegetables and milk for creamy soup.

nutrition_guidelines.age_6_12_months: Continue breastfeeding + introduce complementary foods gradually
nutrition_guidelines.age_1_2_years: 3 meals + 2 snacks daily. Focus on iron-rich foods
nutrition_guidelines.age_2_5_years: Regular family meals with appropriate portions. Encourage variety
